case_vignette: A 6-year-old female with history of atopic dermatitis presents with her mother for evaluation of a rash on the right lower leg! The patient's mom reports the rash developed over the past two weeks and may be growing in size after having a few weeks of cold like symptoms! She denies any new topical products, fragrances, or dyes! She has not tried any treatments! Physical examination is remarkable for multiple pink flat topped scaly papules coalescing into plaques in a curvilinear distribution on the right posterior thigh and calf! Punch biopsy reveals a lymphohistiocytic infiltrate, superficial perivascular inflammation and deeper lymphocytic perieccrine inflammation!
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a rash on my right lower leg that has been growing over the past two weeks.
Does the rash itch, burn, or have any other sensations?
No, I haven't experienced any itching, burning, or other sensations with the rash.
Have you noticed any changes in the color or texture of the rash, or has it developed any scales or bumps?
Yes, the rash has developed into pink flat topped scaly bumps that are joining together into patches.
Have you been exposed to any new substances, or do you have any allergies or recent infections?
I haven't been exposed to any new substances like topical products, fragrances, or dyes. However, I did have cold-like symptoms a few weeks ago.
Do you have any personal or family history of skin conditions like eczema, psoriasis, or autoimmune diseases?
Yes, I have a history of atopic dermatitis.
Final Diagnosis: Lichen Planus
